H0.text: In the human body, what eight letter word is used to describe the purulent inflammation of the gums and tooth sockets often leading to lossening of the teeth . Gingivis

H1.text: In the human body, what eight letter word is used to describe the purulent inflammation of the gums and tooth sockets often leading to lossening of the teeth . Periodon

H2.text: In the human body, what eight letter word is used to describe the purulent inflammation of the gums and tooth sockets often leading to lossening of the teeth . Dentitis

H3.text: In the human body, what eight letter word is used to describe the purulent inflammation of the gums and tooth sockets often leading to lossening of the teeth . PYORRHEA

A4.text: The word pyorrhea (alternative spelling: pyorrhoea) comes from the Greek pyorrhoia (πυόρροια), 'discharge of matter', itself from pyon, 'discharge from a sore', rhoē, 'flow', and the suffix -ia.

A5.text: The text refers to gingivitis, not gingivis, as the inflammatory condition of gums.
